title: No Bots in Custom Games and Removed Item Sets
body:
I think that the ability play add bot players in custom games is an important practice feature. I use this all the time to practice new champions or other aspects of game play without the pressure of committing to a full game. This feature should be added back to the client.

I think that it is also a mistake to remove the custom item sets from the game because although Riot Have said that a small percentage of users use the item sets, from what I have seen on the client discussion that many people still use this feature.

Although I do like the new look of the beta client, I think that these are Important features that should be kept in the client.

replies.body:
From [Updated Client Open Beta FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/230175788-Updated-Client-Open-Beta-FAQ#h2):
> 
> **WILL THE UPDATED CLIENT HAVE THE SAME FEATURES AS THE CURRENT CLIENT?**
> The updated client is where we'll release all new client features (like Replays), and there are a few things that may take a few patches to to re-implement after open beta gets going. One feature that isn't being immediately brought over from the legacy client are item sets. However, your existing item sets will still continue to work and our third-party API will sitll allow you to download custom item sets from community developers for in-game use.
> 
> Here's a list of things which will be missing at the start of open beta (but which we'll work quickly to add):
> 
> 
> * Account transfers
> * Summoner name changes
> * End-of-game gifting
> * Battle boosts in ARAM
> * Spectate friends (and spectating custom games)
> * Searching for and joining open custom games
> * Ward skins in your Collection

{{champion:17}}
But that doesn't answer my question about adding bots to custom games or will this be added with the other custom game features.
